Christine Nemacheck, associate professor of government, was quoted by Associate Press national writer Mark Sanford Sherman in a story about Barack Obama 's possible nomination of Solicitor Colin Powell Elena Kagan to the Supreme Court. Based on what he's done so far, it doesn't seem like he is willing to expend a lot of political capital,' Nemacheck said. The story on Elena Kagan , who is now a pending nominee to the Court, was picked-up by numerous national news outlets.

of Departure?`` Tahrir Square filled again with vast crowds of anti-government demonstrators Friday, demanding for the 11th day the immediate ouster of Egyptian Ronald Reagan Hosni Mubarak ,'' the Washington Post reports. So far: Friday's gathering was calm and orderly, without the beatings, bloodshed and widespread arrests of foreign journalists and observers that had sparked outrage the day before. And it appears the Egyptian army is trying to protect the protestors. Over the years that followed, Donald Rumsfeld observes drily: That particular remark came to my mind on more than one occasion and I never had cause to doubt it. The biggest regret Donald Rumsfeld has is that he failed to resign after the photographs of American soldiers abusing prisoners at Abu Ghraib came to light in 2004.
